item.title: 乌克兰冲突和其他地区（包括中东）日益紧张的地缘政治局势刺激了欧洲大型老牌企业及其供应商的订单量

item.title: "日本的估值很有吸引力，股东治理也越来越友好。可能会有更多的整合和并购"。在股市大涨之后，@stuartkirk__ 正在考虑是坚持还是扭转。
item.description:

item.title: 一张图看懂美国住房问题的政治：- 蓝州的民众和政客说他们非常关心住房危机和无家可归者问题，但却不断阻挠住房建设，导致这两个问题越来越严重- 红州只是允许大量新建住房，并不存在住房危机。
item.description:
The politics of America’s housing issues in one chart:

• People and politicians in blue states say they care deeply about the housing crisis and homelessness but keep blocking housing so both get worse

• Red states simply permit loads of new homes and have no housing crisis pic.twitter.com/2A6r0tQSyg

— John Burn-Murdoch (@jburnmurdoch) February 23, 2024

item.title: 早上好，纽约。当你在睡觉时，这是我们阅读量最高的一篇文章。

item.title: 乔-拜登（Joe Biden）政府希望看到巴勒斯坦权力机构控制加沙，但以色列总理办公室连夜发布的一份一页纸文件却只字未提该权力机构的任何作用，并拒绝接受国际社会为承认巴勒斯坦权力机构而采取的单方面措施。
item.description:
A one-page document, released overnight by the Israeli prime minister’s office, makes no mention of any role for the Palestinian Authority that Joe Biden's administration wants to see take control of Gaza and rejects unilateral international steps towards recognition of a… pic.twitter.com/OweRuf1Xgx

— Financial Times (@FT) February 23, 2024

item.title: 俄罗斯展现出了令人惊讶的持续作战能力。西方国家对乌克兰的弹药供应放缓，使得沃洛德梅尔-泽连斯基总统面临着对其领导能力的最大考验。
item.description:
Russia has displayed a surprising ability to sustain its war-fighting capacity.

The slowdown in western ammunition supplies to Ukraine leaves President Volodymyr Zelenskyy facing arguably the greatest test yet of his leadership.https://t.co/dGdWRU5drB pic.twitter.com/kb9vXyCu4A

— Financial Times (@FT) February 23, 2024

item.title: 麦肯锡领导的智囊团在 2015 年为中央政府开展的一个项目中建议中国深化企业与军队之间的合作，并推动外国公司退出敏感行业
item.description:

item.title: "一位北约官员周四向 @FT 证实，斯托尔滕贝格说基辅有权自卫，包括打击乌克兰境外的俄罗斯合法军事目标。@HenryJFoy @maxseddon @IKoshiw
item.description:

— Christopher Miller (@ChristopherJM) February 22, 2024

item.title: "乌克兰人根本不在乎这些炮弹来自何方、由谁买单。我们在为缩写争论不休，而他们却在前线受苦受难"@hallbenjamin & I on the $1.5bn scramble to find artillery for Ukraine while EU capitals squabbble @ft
item.description:
“The Ukrainians couldn’t care less where these shells come from and who pays for them. We’re arguing over acronyms while they suffer on the front line”@hallbenjamin & I on the $1.5bn scramble to find artillery for Ukraine while EU capitals squabble https://t.co/zJYp549cbI @ft

— Henry Foy (@HenryJFoy) February 23, 2024

item.title: 如果您错过了随着天然气和电力批发价格的下降，英国家庭能源价格上限将在 4 月份下降 12
item.description:
In case you missed it: Britain’s household energy price cap is set to fall by 12% in April following a fall in wholesale gas and electricity prices https://t.co/vmQwMWySG1 pic.twitter.com/cYh67Y1prp

— Financial Times (@FT) February 23, 2024

item.title: 尽管我们很想指责政客或社交媒体算法造成了一切的两极分化，但只要有选择，我们完全有能力使自己两极分化。而选择，当然正是我们现在所拥有的：
item.description:
Tempting as it is to blame politicians for the polarisation of everything, or social media algorithms, we are quite capable of polarising ourselves, given the choice. And choice, of course, is exactly what we now have:https://t.co/0q4A84hJXq pic.twitter.com/ATgbMlugyb

— Tim Harford (@TimHarford) February 23, 2024

item.title: Capital One 表示，预计将在 2025 年初完成交易。但美国监管机构可能不这么认为。原因就在这里：
item.description: Capital One has said it expects to complete the deal by early 2025. But US regulators may feel otherwise. Here’s why: on.ft.com/3I7AF2u
